hadiths.author_name_ar: محمد بن الحسين بن محمد بن جعفر الشيباني
hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid concerning the saying of Allah: 'What is the matter with you that when you are asked to go forth in the way of Allah, you cling heavily to the earth?' He said: This refers to when they were commanded with the Tabuk expedition after the conquest (of Makkah) and after (the battle of) Al-Ta'if and after (the battle of) Hunayn. They were commanded to march forth in the summer when the date palms were ripening, the fruit had ripened, and the shade was desirable, which made going forth difficult for them.

hadiths.author_name_ar: محمد بن الحسين بن محمد بن جعفر الشيباني
hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid concerning the saying of Allah: 'If you help him not, surely Allah helped him already when those who disbelieve drove him out from Makkah with one companion.' He said: This is a reference to what happened at the beginning of his affair when they drove him out. The verse means: Allah will aid him just as He aided him when he was the second of two (in the cave with Abu Bakr).

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ called upon the people for the Tabuk expedition, they said: 'Among us are those who are weak, those who have family obligations, those with failing fortunes, and those with pressing concerns.' So Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, revealed: 'Go forth whether you are light-equipped or heavy-equipped.'

hadiths.author_name_ar: محمد بن الحسين بن محمد بن جعفر الشيباني
hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid concerning the saying of Allah: 'May Allah forgive you. Why did you give them leave until those who told the truth were made manifest to you and you had known the liars?' And that is because some people said: Ask the Messenger of Allah for permission, and if he gives you permission, stay behind; but if he does not give you permission, then march forth. Mujahid said concerning this verse from 'May Allah forgive you' to the verse 'There is no blame on the doers of good': All that is between these verses is about the hypocrites.
